spell.name: Drang's Morning After (HB)
spell.text:
Originally developed as a hangover cure by a suffering pirate, Drang's Morning After instantly cures the effects of poison on the target. The caster cracks an egg, which the target must consume raw, fueling the spell with small bits of abjuration magic that instantly soothes the stomach and head.
Source: GM Toolkit - Bandits & Brigands (Third Party)

spell.name: Pickpocket (HB)
spell.text:
You conjure a small, invisible conduit between your hands and a point within range, allowing you to reach through space and pilfer from afar. The conduit is intangible, undetectable by normal means, and large enough for your hands to pass through. You can use your action on each of your turns to attempt to steal a small object such as a pouch, scroll, potion, or similar item, from a creature you can see within the spell's range. The conduit can be moved up to 30 feet as a bonus action. When you attempt to steal from a creature, make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) or Intelligence (Arcana) check, contested by the target's Wisdom (Perception) check. On a success, you retrieve one unattended item the creature is visibly carrying (such as on their belt or in a satchel). On a failure, the attempt is noticed and the spell immediately ends. Items gripped or actively wielded cannot be taken using the spell.
Source: GM Toolkit - Bandits & Brigands (Third Party)

spell.name: Poisoned Blade (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (The fang of an adder)
spell.text:
You imbue one melee weapon with virulent magical toxins. For the duration, attacks made with that weapon deal an additional 1d6 poison damage on a hit. The first time each turn that the poisoned weapon hits a creature, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 13) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. This spell has no effect on constructs, undead, or creatures immune to poison.
Source: GM Toolkit - Bandits & Brigands (Third Party)

spell.name: Lemmy's Giant Stride (HB)
spell.text:
Created to help the caster reach the window of a tower without being seen, this spell greatly increases the climbing and movement speed of the target. For the duration, the target of this spell's movement speed is doubled, and they gain a climbing speed equal to their movement speed. if the target already has a climb speed, it is doubled.
Source: GM Toolkit - Bandits & Brigands (Third Party)

spell.name: Brilliant Flash (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (A pinch of magnesium wrapped in cloth)
spell.text:
You speak a word of power and hurl the charged components toward your enemies, unleashing a searing burst of light and sound. Each creature within a 30-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded and deafened until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also incapacitated for the same duration. A creature affected by this spell may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending all effects on itself on a success. This spell has no effect on creatures that are already blinded, defeaned, or both.
Source: GM Toolkit - Bandits & Brigands (Third Party)
